name: Heimlich for Others (Adult)
description: Perform Heimlich maneuver on a choking adult
warning: Only use if person cannot cough, speak, or breathe. For adults only.
emergency_notes: If person becomes unconscious, start CPR immediately

steps.title: If Someone is Choking
steps.description: Don't give them water because again, it can make things worse
steps.voice_prompt: Do NOT give water to a choking person. Ask if they are choking. Look for the universal choking sign.
steps.critical_warning: Water can make choking worse - never give water to someone who is choking

steps.title: If the Patient Can't Cough
steps.description: Quickly stand behind the person and follow the correct position
steps.voice_prompt: Stand behind the person. Wrap your arms around their waist. Position yourself slightly to the side.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Tell the person what you're about to do to help them stay calm

steps.title: Correct Hand Positioning
steps.description: Make sure that your hands and arms are below the ribs before thrusting.
steps.voice_prompt: Make a fist with one hand. Place it just above the navel, below the ribcage. Grasp your fist with your other hand.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Position must be below the ribs to avoid rib fractures and above the navel for effectiveness

steps.title: Thrusting
steps.description: Thrust the belly of the person choking repeatedly until they are free from the object
steps.voice_prompt: Perform quick, forceful inward and upward thrusts. Repeat until the object is expelled or person becomes unconscious.
steps.critical_warning: If person becomes unconscious, lay them down and immediately start CPR
